feed.title: Google Cloud: Google Distributed Cloud (software only) for VMware
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Google Distributed Cloud (software only) for VMware

entry.content:
Google Distributed Cloud (software only) for VMware 1.31.700-gke.72 is now available for [download](https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/distributed-cloud/vmware/docs/downloads). To upgrade, see [Upgrade a cluster](https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/distributed-cloud/vmware/docs/how-to/upgrading). Google Distributed Cloud 1.31.700-gke.72 runs on Kubernetes v1.31.10-gke.200.
If you are using a third-party storage vendor, check the [GDC Ready storage partners](https://cloud.google.com/anthos/docs/resources/partner-storage) document to make sure the storage vendor has already passed the qualification for this release.
After a release, it takes approximately 7 to 14 days for the version to become available for use with [GKE On-Prem API clients](https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/distributed-cloud/vmware/docs/how-to/cluster-lifecycle-management-tools): the Google Cloud console, the gcloud CLI, and Terraform.
entry.summary: Google Distributed Cloud for VMware 1.31.700-gke.72 is now available. This release runs on Kubernetes v1.31.10-gke.200. Before upgrading, ensure your third-party storage vendor is qualified for this release. The new version will be available via Google Cloud console, gcloud CLI, and Terraform within 7-14 days.
entry.title: Announcement: New Google Distributed Cloud for VMware Release

entry.content:
The following issues were fixed in 1.31.700-gke.72:
* Fixed vulnerabilities listed in [Vulnerability fixes](https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/distributed-cloud/vmware/docs/vulnerabilities).
entry.summary: Vulnerabilities found in previous versions have been fixed. For more details, see the release notes.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed vulnerabilities in 1.31.700-gke.72

entry.title: Announcement: Google Distributed Cloud for VMware 1.30.1100-gke.67 Released

entry.content:
The following issues were fixed in 1.30.1100-gke.67:
* Fixed vulnerabilities listed in [Vulnerability fixes](https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/distributed-cloud/vmware/docs/vulnerabilities).
entry.summary: This release addresses security vulnerabilities found in the previous version. For more details, please refer to the official documentation on vulnerability fixes.
entry.title: Fixed: Security vulnerabilities fixed

entry.content:

After a release, it takes approximately 7 to 14 days for the version to become available for use with [GKE On-Prem API clients](https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/distributed-cloud/vmware/docs/how-to/cluster-lifecycle-management-tools): the Google Cloud console, the gcloud CLI, and Terraform.
entry.summary: Google Distributed Cloud for VMware version 1.32.200-gke.1000 is now available. This release runs on Kubernetes v1.32.4-gke.1000. For upgrades, refer to the documentation. If using third-party storage, ensure compatibility with this release.
entry.title: Announcement: New Google Distributed Cloud for VMware Release

entry.title: Announcement: New Google Distributed Cloud for VMware Release

entry.content: For clusters configured with [advanced clusters](https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/distributed-cloud/vmware/docs/concepts/advanced-clusters), introduced an Envoy sidecar into the GKE Identity Service to increase security, reliability, and performance.
entry.summary: The GKE Identity Service for advanced clusters now includes an Envoy sidecar to enhance security, reliability, and performance.
entry.title: Changed: GKE Identity Service Security Update
